intro: Zanthoxylum riedelianum subsp. kellermanii, commonly known as the Kellerman's prickly ash, is a shrub native to Central America and parts of the Caribbean. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its compound leaves and spiny stems. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that give way to red, fleshy berries. Its foliage is often used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory properties. The species is adapted to tropical and subtropical climates, thriving in well-drained soils.
